title: Profs give how many LORs for abroad unis?

comments.body: It depends on the professor. The max one can give is 5 iirc

u/rowlet-owl will tell you all you need to know  
On a serious note, I got 10 LoRs from one prof in CSE and the rest gave me like 3-4 each

There is no "max". It depends on the prof, there is no guideline set on profs by PES. Depends a lot on the relationship you share with them and your working history. I've been fortunate to get 7-9 from the ones I was close to but also unfortunate enough to get 2-3 from a few I felt I deserved more from.

It's best to get LORs from profs you have a working history with, either as a TA, RA or otherwise. Otherwise, the LOR doesn't carry too much weight (look into DWIC LORs).
I've become some counselor here eh
There is no "max". Depends on the prof.

bro what 7-9 LoRs from 1 professor alone? isn't an LoR sort of like a feedback/impression of the professor about the student? What can a professor write in 10 different LoRs? (no offense or insult implied I'm just curious)
All 10 LORs will be pretty much identical. 10 LORs means LORs were submitted to 10 different universities.
An LOR isn't a physical entity. Getting N LORs mean the prof agreed to submitting the same LOR for N different applications.
It depends on how many you ask and your relationship with them. Some may be more strict to how they give them
oh wait I assumed the professor gives you an LOR and you just reuse it for all the universities you're applying to
